info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 23 at 8:57AM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
At 857 AM MST /957 AM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a shower over Wahweap, or 6 miles north of Page, moving northeast at 25 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects and cause dangerous boating/rafting conditions on Lake Powell and portions of the Colorado River. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible.
Locations impacted include... Page, Trapeze Cove, Page Municipal Airport, Antelope Point Marina, Antelope Island, LeChee, Antelope Canyon, Glen Canyon Dam, Wahweap, NMS Beach, Horseshoe Bend, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, Grand Canyon National Park, Golliard Park, Lees Ferry, Vermilion Cliffs National Monument and Lake Powell.
This includes the following slot canyons... Upper Antelope Canyon, Lower Antelope Canyon, Butterfly Canyon, Stateline Wash, Owl Canyon, Rattlesnake Canyon, Labyrinth Canyon and Face Canyon.
This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 544 and 556. the Colorado River between river miles 0 and 1. State Route 98 between mile markers 548 and 549.
This includes the following recreation areas and campgrounds... Lee's Ferry Campground, Lees Ferry Campground, Wahweap Campground, Page Lake Powell Campground, Paria Beach Camp Site, Ropes Trail Camp Site, Ferry Swale Camp Site, Twin Stripes Camp Site and Lees Ferry Camp Site.
info.instruction:
Monitor the weather situation closely and be alert for threatening weather conditions.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
If on or near Lake Powell, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
